Recipe.Name: Asparagus Side Dish
Recipe.ProcessList:
Blanch asparagus until tender.
Drain well.
Place on a serving platter and garnish with red pepper stripes and goat cheese.
Cover with dressing.
Sprinkle capers on top.
Sprinkle parmesan cheese on top.
Dressing
Combine white wine vinegar, dijon mustard, minced garlic, taragon, salt, pepper, and olive oil.

Recipe.Name: Banana Bread
Recipe.ProcessList:
Mix butter and sugar.
Add eggs, buttermilk, and bananas.
Add flour and baking soda.
Add nuts/raisons.
Use a greased pan.
Bake at 350F for 35-40 minutes (3 little loaf pans) or 70 minutes (big loaf pan).

Recipe.Name: Beef Stroganoff

Ingredient.Name: Round steak or sirloin steak cut in 2 to 3 inch strips

Recipe.ProcessList:
* Saute Onion and Remove. * Dredge beef in seasonings and brown. * Add undrained mushrooms, onions, catsup, bouillon and wine. * Cover and Cook over low heat for 1 hour or until tender. * Uncover, and add bacon and sour cream until heated through.
Serve over wide buttered noodles. Sprinkle with snip of fresh parsely just before serving.

Recipe.Name: Beef Stroginoff
Recipe.ProcessList: *Slice the Onion, medium fine. *Slice the Mushrooms, medium fine. *Slice the Beef into thin strips. *Saute the Onions until very brown/carmelized. *Before the Onions are done, throw in the mushroom and saute until tender. *Remove the Onions and Mushrooms from the pan. *Coat the beef in flour and the saute in the butter until nicely browned. *Add Onions and Mushrooms back into pan with Beef and add consume. *Add Red Wine as needed. *Add Water as needed. *Let simmer for an hour or so. *Add sour cream, slowly mixing as you go at the right before serving. *Serve on egg noodles or rice.
Recipe.Comments: *Don't use a cast iron pan for this one. *The iron will leach and you meal will come out gray.

Recipe.Name: Cajun Chicken Mustard
Recipe.ProcessList:
Add the cajun seasoning to the bread crumbs, and toss the chicken tenders in the mix to coat well.
Heat the oil until the bread crumbs fry when sprinkled in.
Fry the chicken until golden brown, about 1 minute.
Bring the milk and the butter to a rapid boil, whisk in the mustard and heat.
Add the chicken to the sauce and warm through, sprinkle with 2 tsp of Cajun seasoning and serve.
Recipe.Comments:
1/6 -> only need 1 cup crumbs and 1/2 cajun seasoning.
Use 3/4 c oil.
3 oz Dijon only.

Recipe.Name: Carne Asada Marinade
Recipe.ProcessList:
Cut the meat thin if possible, marinade for 1-8 hours.
Grill meat on the barbique or broil until done well. (rare isn't a good thing for this).
Recipe.Comments: Marinade for 1-8 hours. Anything longer and the meat breaks down and becomes mushy.

Recipe.Name: Carrot Cake Cookies
Recipe.ProcessList:
Preheat oven to 350°. Line two baking sheets with Silpat baking mats or parchment paper, and set aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine sugars and butter; beat until light and fluffy, 3 to 4 minutes. Add eggs and vanilla, and beat on medium speed until well combined.
In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger; stir to combine. Gradually add flour to butter mixture; mix on a low speed until just blended. Mix in oats, carrots, and raisins. Chill dough in refrigerator until firm, at least 1 hour.
Using a 1/2-ounce ice-cream scoop, scoop dough onto prepared baking sheets, leaving 2 inches between cookies. Transfer to oven, and bake until browned and crisped, rotating pan halfway through baking to ensure even color, 12 to 15 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Repeat baking process with remaining dough. Once cooled completely, use an offset spatula to spread about 2 teaspoons of cream-cheese filling onto a cookie. Sandwich together with a second cookie. Repeat with remaining cookies. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days in the refrigerator.

Recipe.Name: Ceviche

Ingredient.Name: chile peppers, chopped or canned chopped

Recipe.ProcessList: * Mix together in a glass bowl. * Refrigerate for 24 hours.
Recipe.Comments:
Mandy: * I usually add extra shrimp. I buy the big size shrimp that they sell at Costco or Trader Joes and cut the shrimp into 3 pieces. This shrimp taste better than the small cocktail shrimp. Of course you can find this shrimp at QFC as well. Cheaper at Costco. Anyway you get the idea. I would also add a 1 2 of lime juice and then see if you need anymore as it sits for a while. * Serve with chips. * I personally think that it tastes a lot better with about 6 corona's and a guy named Jose' serving it to me poolside.
Enjoy!!!!

Recipe.Name: Cream Cheese Frosting

Ingredient.Name: butter, unsalted (cut into pieces, room temperature)

Recipe.ProcessList: Place cream cheese in a medium mixing bowl. Using a rubber spatula, soften cream cheese. Gradually add butter, and continue beating until smooth and well blended. Sift in confectioners’ sugar, and continue beating until smooth. Add vanilla, and stir to combine.
Recipe.Comments: Goes with Martha's Carrot Cake Cookie Recipe.

Recipe.Name: Eggnog Pound Cake
Recipe.ProcessList:
Grease a 10in tube or bundt pan with softened butter, press almonds on sides and bottom of pan; set aside.
In a large bowl, combine cake mix, nutmeg, eggs, eggnog, the melted butter, and rum.
Using an electric mixer, beat until smooth and creamy (about 4 minutes) or beat for about 450 strokes with a wooden spoon. Pount batter into prepared pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45-55 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted into center comes out clean.
Let cool in pan for 10 minutes; then invert cake onto a rack to cool completely.

Recipe.Name: Garlic-Lemon Green Beans with Toasted Bread Crumbs

Ingredient.Name: high-quality sandwich bread, ground fine in a food processor

Recipe.ProcessList: * Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat; when melted, add the bread crumbs and cook, stirring frequently, until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. * Transfer to a medium bowl, stir in ¼ teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, and the Parmesan; set aside. * Wipe out the skillet. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons butter, garlic, and ¼ teaspoon salt; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the garlic is golden, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in the flour, pepper flakes, and thyme, then toss in the green beans. * Add the broth and increase the heat to medium-high; cover and cook until the beans are partly tender but still crisp at the center, about 4 minutes. Uncover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the beans are tender, about 4 minutes. * Stir in the lemon juice; adjust the seasonings with salt and pepper. * Transfer to a serving dish, sprinkle with bread crumbs, and serve.

Recipe.Name: Hollandaise Sauce
Recipe.ProcessList:
Combine egg yolks, lemon juice, salt, and cayenne pepper in blender.
Blend on high speed for 3 secs.
Melt butter, slowly add to egg mixture while blender is on high speed.
Keep warm over hot water, keep stirring.
For poached eggs
Heat water
Add 1 Tbsp white vinegar
Add eggs in simmering water while stirring
Cooks, 2-3 minutes.
Recipe.Comments: 12/25/03 - Use only 2 TBSP of lemon if using only 1 stick of butter. Add two dashes of cayenne. Poach eggs to CS liking (4 minutes)

Recipe.Name: Love Salad

Ingredient.Name: French Bread cut into 1 inch cubes
bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1 inch cubes
bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1 inch cubes

Recipe.ProcessList:
Heat oil in a large saut?an.
Add the bread and salt; cook over low to medium heat, tossing frequently, for 10 minutes, or until nicely browned.
Add more oil as needed.
For vinaigrette, whisk together ingredients.
In a large bowl, mix the tomatoes, cucumber, red pepper, yellow pepper, red onion, basil and capers.
Add the bread cubes and toss with the vinaigrette.
Season liberally with salt and pepper.

Recipe.Name: New Year's Prosperity Soup
Recipe.ProcessList:
Cover peas with water and bring to a boil.
Turn heat down, let peas simmer for 30 minutes.
Add remaining ingredients and stir well.
Let simmer for 40 minutes or until desired consistency.
Do not over cook peas.
Recipe.Comments: Can be served with corn bread muffins or biscuits if desired.

Recipe.Name: Peanut Butter Cookies
Recipe.ProcessList:
Heat oven to 350 degrees. Line several baking sheets with parchment paper, and set aside.
In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream butter, peanut butter, and both sugars together until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla, and mix on medium speed until well combined.
In a medium mixing bowl, sift flour and baking soda together. Add to the butter mixture, and beat just to combine.
Scoop out 2 TBSP of dough, shape into a ball, and place on one of the prepared baking sheets. Repeat with remaining dough, placing scoops 3 inches apart. Dip the tines of a fork in warm water; press the dough balls lightly with the back of the fork to flatten them slightly (dip the fork back in the water for each dough ball, to prevent sticking). Sprinkle with a few peanuts, if desired.
Transfer to the oven, and bake until golden brown, 18 to 20 minutes, rotating the baking sheets between the oven shelves halfway through baking. Transfer baking sheets to a wire rack to cool. Store in an airtight container at room temperature up to 1 week.

Recipe.Name: Pumpkin Seeds
Recipe.ProcessList:
Stir all ingredients
Layout on baking sheet.
Bake for 1-1/2 to 2 hours at 250 degrees.

Recipe.Name: Puppy's Breath Chili

Ingredient.Name: Beef, Tri Tip or Sirloin Tip
Dried New Mexico Chili Pepper (boiled and pureed)
Dried California Chili Pepper (boiled and pureed)

Recipe.ProcessList:
Brown meat in Wesson Oil for about ½ hour over medium heat.
Add onion and enough beef broth to cover meat.
Bring to a boil and cook for 15 minutes.
Add 1 Tbls cumin and ½ tsp of Oregano.
Reduce heat to light boil and add ½ of the garlic.
Add ½ half of the chili powder and cook for 10 minutes.
Add Hunts tomato sauce with the pulp from the dried peppers and remaining garlic.
Add any remaining beef broth and chicken broth for desired consistency.
Cook for one hour on medium heat stirring occasionally.
Add remaining chili powders and cumin Simmer for 25 minutes on low to medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Turn up heat to light boil and add Tabasco pepper sauce, salt to taste, brown sugar and juice of lime.
Simmer on medium heat until you are ready to enter this championship recipe at your next cookoff or to a group of hungry chili lovers.

Recipe.Name: Roasted Squash Soup
Recipe.ProcessList: * Preheat oven to 425. Line a baking sheet with a Silpat, and set aside. * Season squash halves with salt and pepper, and tuck 4 sprigs thyme into cavity of each squash half. Place halves, cut side down, on prepared baking sheet; place whole garlic head next to squash. Drizzle garlic with olive oil, and season with salt. * Transfer the baking sheet to the oven, and roast until squash is tender when pierced with a fork and garlic is soft, about 40 minutes. Remove from oven, and let stand until cool enough to handle. * Discard thyme from squash. Using a large spoon, scoop out the flesh of each squash half into a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Squeeze out 4 cloves of garlic, and add to food processor; reserve remaining garlic cloves for another use (wrap in plastic, and refrigerate up to 1 week). Add about 1 cup stock, and process until smooth. With machine running, add remaining stock through the feed tube until soup reaches the desired consistency. * Transfer soup to a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
Recipe.Comments:
Martha, Dec 2002, page 197 (if you can find the stupid page numbers at all.)
Cristie's Changes: * Swapped Rosemary for Thyme (had it in the garden) * Added a little half-n-half (for creaminess). * Added a little Worcestershire (meatiness). * 1/2 head of garlic instead of 4 cloves (what the heck).

Recipe.Name: Sour Cream Enchilada
Recipe.ProcessList:
Combine cream of chicken and celery with equal parts sour cream for sauce.
Precook poultry.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Assembly
To assemble (make) enchiladas, dip tortilla into warm oil (do not cook, this is just to make it easier to roll) fill tortilla with chopped poultry, chopped onions, chopped chilis and grated cheese.
Add teaspoon of sauce to inside of tortilla. Roll up and place in baking pan.
Add remaining sauce over finished enchiladas.
Bake until sauce bubbles.
Recipe.Comments: Carrie uses only cream of chicken soup w/equal parts sour cream. Too much sauce otherwise.

Recipe.Name: Split Pea Soup
Recipe.ProcessList:
Soak peas overnight.
Rinse peas in collander.
Add peas, ham hock and chopped onion to pot.
Add 2 quarts of water.
Boil, 3-5 hours.
Salt and pepper to taste after peas are cooked.
